alert.note: Alert for Bond; Calhoun; Fayette; Jersey; Macoupin; Madison; Monroe; Montgomery; St. Clair (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 16 at 1:38PM CST until February 17 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of Illinois, including the following areas, Bond IL, Calhoun IL, Clinton IL, Fayette IL, Greene IL, Jersey IL, Macoupin IL, Madison IL, Marion IL, Monroe IL, Montgomery IL, Randolph IL, Saint Clair and Washington IL. Portions of Missouri, including the following areas, Callaway MO, Cole MO, Crawford MO, Franklin MO, Gasconade MO, Iron MO, Jefferson MO, Lincoln MO, Madison MO, Montgomery MO, Osage MO, Reynolds MO, Saint Charles MO, Saint Francois MO, Saint Louis City MO, Saint Louis MO, Sainte Genevieve MO, Warren MO and Washington MO. * WHEN...From 6 PM CST this evening through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rain and thunderstorms will likely occur repeatedly over similar locations this evening into Thursday, resulting in minor flooding. Total rainfall in the watch area will between 1 and 3 inches with locally higher amounts.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Bond; Calhoun; Fayette; Jersey; Macoupin; Madison; Monroe; Montgomery; St. Clair
